channel.title: davewiner tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from davewiner.

item.description: Is @elonmusk a developer?

@pilhofer yes i understand -- when the pandemic hit i unsubbed from the athletic. they had nothing to cover. i think their subscriber base must have evaporated. i think this is their attempt to try to lure us back. hasn't worked with me yet. ;-)

@phonetonote @VladyslavSitalo @dvargas92495 @hashbrown490 @TfTHacker yes! i was hoping it would work that way when i did the package. no need to guess about how opml works. if you have questions about that code, it's very much part of what i'm working on now, so please let me know.

Every time I tune into twitter it's the same four messages taking up the whole home page. The big downside in having an algorithm is that they have bugs and do shit like this. BTW, a bunch of them are about Morning Joe. I don't think he's even on now.
@pilhofer @jeffjarvis You're not missing anything. Any time I tune into it, within 5 minutes I'm channel surfing looking for a basketball game to watch.
@KenSmith @ReasonedWriting If you want to broaden this thread to more people thinking about this, include the hashtag #toolsforthought.

@TaylorLorenz He might be really good for Twitter's board. He's actually made software, himself -- and presumably knows how to write a bug report. And he uses the product. I don't imagine too many of the other board members at Twitter really use it. Leadership from users, what a concept. üòÄ

1/3 If you're a #toolsforthought person, you must've seen me beating the drum for interop between outliners. My preferred format is OPML, but if real interop is built with another format, I'll support it in Drummer.
2/3 I eased up on my evangelism for OPML because the various teams in #tft seem busy focused on their own products, and aren't thinking a lot about interop these days, I guess. So I got to work on another project, but I'll be coming back to this. I do not give up easily. :-)
3/3 In the meantime, all of my public outlines can be read in any tool that supports OPML. For example this outline of a talk I gave to a class at CUNY yesterday. A link in the next message in this thread.
Here's the link...
https://t.co/lMXpjtoMhI
To get the OPML, click on the orange XML icon in the upper right corner of the page.
And if you want to try my latest outliner..
https://t.co/jBvvd07MwT
It's time to sanction Fox News. They are an ally of Putin.
Twitter will appoint Elon Musk to its board of directors. https://t.co/BefsgMXuoW

@ReasonedWriting @KenSmith I gave a talk at a class at CUNY yesterday and did an outline beforehand. I didn‚Äôt need to refer to it, because outlining it put the structure in my mind, and I could work from that as I lectured. https://t.co/lMXpjtoMhI
These scholars argue America should be broken up into 13 regions. https://t.co/bgGSQhnfLS
@padresj Have you been to LaGuardia?

@KenSmith It‚Äôs a hostage situation. It‚Äôs not her kid. The flowers at her feet are a virtual land mine. The people aren‚Äôt real. The kid is a miniature Russian agent, spying on the owners of the house, who are vacationing in zucks metaverse, upstairs in the bathroom off the study.
‚ÄúEntire families slaughtered. Adults tortured, children raped and then killed.‚Äù https://t.co/DY0GCqHOHL
North of Kyiv, Borodianka - a ruined town, emerges after Russia leaves. https://t.co/SnXJntzQO7
Are you watching the NCAA championship game?
2017: Rules for standards-makers. https://t.co/U8sueEiIyK
Obi Toppin, Immanuel Quickley prompting Knicks' questions. https://t.co/evMYEfrUz4
Why to Care About Privacy After Years of Sharing Data. https://t.co/S8xKhXIAy8
